meanings.definition: The involuntary discharge of urine; bed-wetting.
meanings.sent1: Bed-wetting, also known as enureses, can be common in young children.
meanings.sent2: Enureses can be a source of embarrassment for some individuals.
meanings.sent3: The sleepover turned into a disaster when enureses made an unexpected appearance.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure manifested in her dreams as enureses, symbolizing her anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The sound of enureses echoing in the night haunted him for years.

meanings.definition: To experience enuresis; to wet the bed.
meanings.sent1: Sometimes, children enureses due to deep sleep and underdeveloped bladder control.
meanings.sent2: She enureses occasionally, especially when feeling stressed.
meanings.sent3: The prankster decided to enureses as a joke, but it didn't go as planned.
meanings.sent4: His inability to speak up felt like he was enuresing his emotions instead.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing emotions threatened to enureses out of her eyes.
